Answer: This answer is slightly unrelated but very appropriate.NEVER hitch yourself with a technology. Technology keeps changing. Drastically and very fast. Hell, the latest and greatest of today might be abandoned in six months. Or go in such a different direction that it will not make any sense or not fit you. That’s 6 months gone for you and you’re back to zero.Instead. Step a level down and figure out the general direction of that and similar tech that you work in or want to work in. Be the kind of person who could write that tech (but don’t) and then pick up groups of those techs with real projecThis answer is slightly unrelated but very appropriate.NEVER hitch yourself with a technology. Technology keeps changing. Drastically and very fast. Hell, the latest and greatest of today might be abandoned in six months. Or go in such a different direction that it will not make any sense or not fit you. That’s 6 months gone for you and you’re back to zero.Instead. Step a level down and figure out the general direction of that and similar tech that you work in or want to work in. Be the kind of person who could write that tech (but don’t) and then pick up groups of those techs with real projects. Fail fast fail often in the techniques.Now you’ll be able to pick up things fast and run in those general directions. An architect level person driving the direction. Such people are infinitely more valuable. And they don’t need to change every time the direction of tech changes.Lastly a very appropriate thought for you.A software “architect” is not an appropriate term as it conveys rigidness and firmness in whatever is built. Something that doesn’t change. And you know how wrong that is in tech.A software gardener is more appropriate. You plant the seeds and nurture how and where things grow. Where appropriate you cut them off. Or grow them somewhere else. Or grow faster. Or grow slower. Or totally rip it out and start again.An “architect” cannot do that easily.

Answer: Transfer learning in ML models.Humans are really good at generalizing. We only have to see a few dogs before we can recognize a dog when we see one.Machines are not. ML models require millions of examples before forming a reliable classifier, and that classifier is very specific to the data on which it was trained. If your training data doesn't include dogs with three legs, the model won't recognize them. A machine that plays Go is useless at checkers.Transfer learning is the ability to apply a model from one domain to a different one. It's hypothesized that the reason humans learn so quicklyTransfer learning in ML models.Humans are really good at generalizing. We only have to see a few dogs before we can recognize a dog when we see one.Machines are not. ML models require millions of examples before forming a reliable classifier, and that classifier is very specific to the data on which it was trained. If your training data doesn't include dogs with three legs, the model won't recognize them. A machine that plays Go is useless at checkers.Transfer learning is the ability to apply a model from one domain to a different one. It's hypothesized that the reason humans learn so quickly is that we are fitting new examples into our existing knowledge rather than forming entirely new categories. If we could teach machines to do the same, they would learn exponentially faster and apply that learning more effectively.Transfer learning is a very hot topic in AI research right now, so I expect major breakthroughs in the next few years. I think this may be sufficient to achieve artificial general intelligence, but even if not, it will dramatically extend the range of tasks that machines can accomplish.

Subaru is safety, premiumness, outdoorsman experience, awd. Subaru wins with outdoorsman, families, people needing safety and awd. All those values work together for a car that’s catered to your health and wellness. Safety and awd go together. Outdoorsman likes health which also goesthe people’s health and wellness.I still think advanced technology and implementation of advanced technology is critical. Meaning, autonomous software, advanced hardware.I think brands still have it right by specializing their brand with a few synergistic brand specializations for a specific target market segment. Subaru is safety, premiumness, outdoorsman experience, awd. Subaru wins with outdoorsman, families, people needing safety and awd. And, it’s a premium product which also makes sense.So, I think brands and products will always specialize for a specific market segment based on lifestyle. There is the health and wellness premium brand bose. There is skullcandy which is the fun lower tier brand. There is sony which is premium and masstige. Also, higher end European brands, and beats by dre which is mainstream popular premium brand. House of marley and these small brands are the hipster type of brand. Essentially, if a person likes health and wellness they want it exactly like Bose. If they want the mainstream popular brand they want beats by dre. If they want a more tech focused product they want Sony.In summary, I think brands are becoming more specialized and tailored to people’s lifestyle and deep needs and wants. Health and wellness is satisfying. Hipster lifestyle is satisfying. Luxury is satisfying for a richer or aspirational person. And, popular premium, and performance brand is another type of person. They want it tailored to them. And, you will see more tech and advanced tech implemented to better achieve those specialization.

Answer: You stop existing.Your body decomposes.The people who loved you remember you for a while.Then, they, too, die, and people mostly forget about you.Your grandfather had two grandfathers. If you’re like most people, you will know very little, if anything at all, about those men. They are dead. The people who knew them are dead. That’s what will happen to you. That’s what will happen to me.Is it sad? Maybe. But I’ll be too dead to notice.

Answer: I believe that a computer will become the primary home control, security, entertainment, education, and communication device in middle class housing.Natural Language voice recognition will be it's primary means of control and it will be  able to interact with various household member using different personas and levels of security.Initially distrust, technical glitches and a certain creepiness factor will prevent full acceptence of the technology but as the benefits and capabilities increase almost all of the population will be be convinced.Elderly people will be much safer in the home environI believe that a computer will become the primary home control, security, entertainment, education, and communication device in middle class housing.Natural Language voice recognition will be it's primary means of control and it will be  able to interact with various household member using different personas and levels of security.Initially distrust, technical glitches and a certain creepiness factor will prevent full acceptence of the technology but as the benefits and capabilities increase almost all of the population will be be convinced.Elderly people will be much safer in the home environment with the house monitoring everything from their medicine intake to their biometrics and will be able to summon help in the case of accident or remind their charge of doctor appointments.Robbery and home invasion will become much less common and more risky for criminals with the constant video surveilance that is activated when an unknown person or persons gains entry to the home and the ability to contact authorities directly as soon as hostile intentions are detected..Autonomous computerized vehicles will allow the elderly much improved mobility and reduce driving risk as their motor and cognitive function begin to be impaired from old age.  Autonomous taxi service will make the service more cost effective than owning your own personal vehicle in many cases.  Once driver costs are removed from the equation.  Vehicles can self-park at various locations throughout the city based on demand an be dispatched quickly.  Such vehicles will eliminate deaths due to drunk driving and minimize fuel expense by driving the vehicles in optimized route selection and acceleration/braking pattern.  The vehicles will never get tired and properly maintained they should be capable of near 24 hour transportation.  Insurance and liability costs for the taxi companies will also be greatly reduced.Such vehicles will provide entertainment during the drive and allow commuters to link to their home or office computers systems to conbuct personal business in route.  Some commuters in heavily congested urban areas will gain back two hours of time to either sleep, conduct business or enjoy media giving many of the same benefits as telecommuting.House computer systems will also monitor energy consumption and generation. Solar energy panels will become much more cost effective as higher csunlight conversion efficiencies are obtained using various nanotechnology breakthroughs.  Battery technology will also improve from nanotechnologies allowing the excess solar energy generated during the day to be used at night and possibly removing the need for residential dependency on the power grid altogether.House computers will be capable of monitoring non-violent offenders remanded by the courts to home incarceration.  Monitoring bracelets currently in use will be able to track the prisoner between home and work release making sure that they do not make any sidetrips and violate their conditions for parole.  The constant location monitoring will make it impossible for them to commit a crime without their presence at the crime scene being known.Media for prisoner rehabilitation can be provided to the house and it can monitor whether the prisoner has watched and been tested on the materials deemed necessary  for their rehabilitation.Teachers will transmit homework assignments and educational materials to the home computer systems.  Children will be able to relisten to material they had problems with or work ahead to later lessons to gain rapid promotion.   Student will have access to other course materials not enrolled in to audit the course or take entirely through the home system to gain credit for taking the course.

Answer: Powered exoskeletons…“I am ze Rhino!”Sure, powered exoskeletons look pretty damn cool. I won’t argue there. And yeah, they’re a hell of a lot better than fighting somebody without one.But, here’s the thing about powered exoskeletons: the person within the exoskeleton limits the exoskeleton’s capabilities. Suddenly, the exoskeleton has to account for a person’s heat tolerance, the types of forces a person can withstand, a person’s range of motion… It’s a mess.Wouldn’t it just be smarter to design a robot instead of an exoskeleton, and man it remotely? Not only would you be able to build a far sPowered exoskeletons…“I am ze Rhino!”Sure, powered exoskeletons look pretty damn cool. I won’t argue there. And yeah, they’re a hell of a lot better than fighting somebody without one.But, here’s the thing about powered exoskeletons: the person within the exoskeleton limits the exoskeleton’s capabilities. Suddenly, the exoskeleton has to account for a person’s heat tolerance, the types of forces a person can withstand, a person’s range of motion… It’s a mess.Wouldn’t it just be smarter to design a robot instead of an exoskeleton, and man it remotely? Not only would you be able to build a far stronger machine — you don’t have to account for human limitations — but you’ll also be able to keep its operatorThere’s a reason why the U.S military invests tons of money into drones and robots, and barely anything into powered exoskeletons.Sorry Tony Stark: your Iron Man suit makes no goddamn sense.

name: Karl Richard Adams
question: https://www.quora.com/What-is-the-next-thing-after-Technology

Answer: Yes. Science fiction doesn’t necessarily speculate about future science. Science fiction is fiction that uses science as a mechanism for examining the human condition. As Isaac Asimov described it:“Science fiction can be defined as that branch of literature which deals with the reaction of human beings to changes in science and technology."You, therefore, could write a fictional story about Henry Ford’s introduction of the assembly line in 1913 and if you examine how that change in technology impacted people, you have written science fiction.

ML models require millions of examples before forming a reliable classifier, and that classifier is very specific to the data on which it was trained. If your training data doesn't include dogs with three legs, the model won't recognize them. Answer: First, I would like to ask a question: How do you know the technology is superior? Is it because the founders said so?Blockchain is very difficult because it combines several branches of knowledge: Computer Science, Economics, Game Theory. Very few people have high proficiency in all 3.I would caution you not to fall trap to what founders say and listen to experts in the field (don’t just believe the hype). Lots of newer cryptocurrencies like to show off how fast they are by claiming x transaction per seconds. What you need to understand is that this is in ideal condition and not real world coFirst, I would like to ask a question: How do you know the technology is superior? Is it because the founders said so?Blockchain is very difficult because it combines several branches of knowledge: Computer Science, Economics, Game Theory. Very few people have high proficiency in all 3.I would caution you not to fall trap to what founders say and listen to experts in the field (don’t just believe the hype). Lots of newer cryptocurrencies like to show off how fast they are by claiming x transaction per seconds. What you need to understand is that this is in ideal condition and not real world conditions. Also you don’t just magically get faster without making a trade-off somewhere else. That last point is almost always not mentioned. If it was that easy, ethereum would have done it a long time ago!Vitalik and the ethereum research team have been working on this for years at a high level. They’ve received contribution from several PhDs and University professors. The amount of brain power that went into ethereum research is very high, so any new comer that claims to be better should also explicitly state what trade-off they made.

Likewise, so was Microsoft when compared with Linux.Beta-max was better than VHS, but doesn't exist any longer.Those who won out because of NETWORK effects. Networks grow for different reasons than what companies do.And once entrenched, they continue to spread.Bitcoin & Ethereum hit critical mass, BTC a couple years ago, ETH last year.Cardano and Rai Blocks will take years to build that same critical mass, if they ever do, and by tYou’re looking at it through the lens of a “company” with the “best technology”.AOL was built on arguably better, more private tech than the internet, but lost out. Likewise, so was Microsoft when compared with Linux.Beta-max was better than VHS, but doesn't exist any longer.Those who won out because of NETWORK effects. Networks grow for different reasons than what companies do.And once entrenched, they continue to spread.Bitcoin & Ethereum hit critical mass, BTC a couple years ago, ETH last year.Cardano and Rai Blocks will take years to build that same critical mass, if they ever do, and by that time, BTC & ETH will have evolved from what they are now.People keep trying to evaluate this industry in terms of better tech, better companies, better teams, etc - that doesn’t mean SHIT when evaluating how networks spread.So go study network effects & then take a fresh look at everything again.Good luck!
